California Work Opportunity and Responsi.name: California Work Opportunity and Responsibility to Kids (CalWORKS)
California Work Opportunity and Responsi.description: With the goal of supporting families in need, CalWORKs helps with housing, food, utilities, clothing or medical care;  immediate short-term help; and possibly ongoing cash assistance to help pay for housing, food and necessary expenses.
eligibility: Requires proof of CA residency (not specific to county)
California Work Opportunity and Responsi.eligibilityText: In general, must have children or be pregnant and live in CA; have US citizenship or legal permission to live in the US; have less than $12,137 in total assets ($18,206 if disabled or 60 years or older); have one or both parents living outside of the home/disabled/working less than 100 hours over the last 4 weeks prior to application. Additional qualifying categories can be found at website.
California Work Opportunity and Responsi.address: DPSS Lincoln Heights Sub-Office 4077 N Mission Rd Los Angeles, CA 90032
California Work Opportunity and Responsi.moreInfo: Other physical addresses can be found here

Cash Assistance Program for Immigrants (.name: Cash Assistance Program for Immigrants (CAPI)
Cash Assistance Program for Immigrants (.description: Cash assistance to certain aged, blind, and disabled legal immigrants ineligible for Supplemental Security Income/State Supplemental Payment (SSI/SSP) due to their immigration status.
eligibility: Requires proof of CA residency (not specific to county)
Cash Assistance Program for Immigrants (.eligibilityText: California resident age 65 or older, blind, or disabled; non-US citizen who meets 8/21/1996 SSI criteria (many categories, but include legal permanent residents/refugees/those with deportation/removal being withheld); have applied for SSI/SSP and been deemed ineligible due to immigration status; assets under $2,000 for individuals ($3,000 for a couple). Additional criteria at link.
Cash Assistance Program for Immigrants (.address: DPSS Lincoln Heights Sub-Office 4077 N Mission Rd Los Angeles, CA 90032
Cash Assistance Program for Immigrants (.moreInfo: Other physical addresses can be found here

General Relief, Medi-Cal, and CalFresh (.name: General Relief, Medi-Cal, and CalFresh (LA County Department of Public Social Services)
General Relief, Medi-Cal, and CalFresh (.description: Cash aid for adults with extremely limited income/resources, and children in certain special circumstances who are ineligible for federal or State programs. May apply online, by telephone, or in person.
eligibility: Requires proof of LA county residence
General Relief, Medi-Cal, and CalFresh (.eligibilityText: LA County resident with monthly net income lower than the maximum GR grant of $221 (monthly net income for a couple: $375). Total cash on hand/in bank account ≤ $100 (≤ $200 for couple/family) Not in violation of probation/parole or avoiding prosecution after a felony conviction. Full eligibility criteria at link.
General Relief, Medi-Cal, and CalFresh (.address: DPSS Lincoln Heights Sub-Office 4077 N Mission Rd Los Angeles, CA 90032
General Relief, Medi-Cal, and CalFresh (.moreInfo: Other physical addresses can be found here

GR Housing Subsidy and Case Management P.name: GR Housing Subsidy and Case Management Program (LA County DPSS)
GR Housing Subsidy and Case Management P.description: Rental assistance to adults and couples without children who are experiencing homelessness or at-risk of homelessness who are receiving a General Relief (GR) grant.
GR Housing Subsidy and Case Management P.eligibilityText: LA County Transition Age Youth (TAY) between the ages of 18-24 years old, or unable to work due to a disability and applying for Supplemental Security Income (SSI) or Veterans Benefits (VB), or Employable and enrolled in the Skills and Training to Achieve Readiness for Tomorrow (START), preparing to find employment.
GR Housing Subsidy and Case Management P.phone:
(866) 613-3777 (Toll free),

(310) 258-7400 (Other Local Number),

(626) 569-1399 (Other Local Number),

(818) 701-8200 (Other Local Number)
GR Housing Subsidy and Case Management P.address: DPSS Lincoln Heights Sub-Office 4077 N Mission Rd Los Angeles, CA 90032
GR Housing Subsidy and Case Management P.moreInfo: Other physical addresses can be found here

Los Angeles County Patient Financial Ser.name: Los Angeles County Patient Financial Services
Los Angeles County Patient Financial Ser.description: Helps patients apply for Medi-Cal or the DHS Financial Assistance Program (“Ability to Pay Program (ATP)”) to pay for their medical care.
Los Angeles County Patient Financial Ser.eligibilityText: LA County residents with income at or under 200% Federal Poverty Level (FPL) and a reduced cost, sliding scale for those over 200% FPL qualify for the ATP
Los Angeles County Patient Financial Ser.moreInfo: Pharmacy Clinic Tower Room A1C109 or see LAG Map to visit Financial Services: English or Español

Refugee Cash Assistance (RCA).name: Refugee Cash Assistance (RCA)
Refugee Cash Assistance (RCA).description: Provides temporary assistance and employment-focused services through the Refugee Employment Program to individuals who are not eligible for other welfare assistance. Included with the RCA financial assistance provided to help pay for housing and other necessary expenses is a monthly CalFresh benefit and Medi-Cal benefits.
Refugee Cash Assistance (RCA).eligibilityText: Eligibility overlaps with CalWORKs criteria AND have verified refugee/asylee status (i.e. I-94 or letter from US government)
Refugee Cash Assistance (RCA).address: DPSS Lincoln Heights Sub-Office 4077 N Mission Rd Los Angeles, CA 90032
Refugee Cash Assistance (RCA).moreInfo: Other physical addresses can be found here

East Los Angeles Regional Center.name: East Los Angeles Regional Center
East Los Angeles Regional Center.description: Employment services for adults with developmental disabilities; run by the CA Department of Developmental Services
East Los Angeles Regional Center.eligibilityText: serves the health districts of Alhambra, East Los Angeles, Northeast, and Whittier within the county of Los Angeles
East Los Angeles Regional Center.hours: M-Th 8AM-4:30PM with after-hours answering service, F 8AM-4PM with after-hours answering service
East Los Angeles Regional Center.moreInfo: for other centers, please see https://www.dds.ca.gov/rc/listings/

WorkSource: from Los Angeles Economic &.name: WorkSource: from Los Angeles Economic & Workforce Development Department (EWDD)
WorkSource: from Los Angeles Economic &.description: Free employment and employer/entrepreneurial support for adults, dislocated workers, veterans, the homeless and the re-entry population, with services provided in multiple languages.
eligibility: Requires proof of LA county residence
WorkSource: from Los Angeles Economic &.eligibilityText: Adults age 24 and older (YouthSource available for LA residents ages 14 to 24 years)

YouthSource: from Los Angeles Economic &.name: YouthSource: from Los Angeles Economic & Workforce Development Department (EWDD)
YouthSource: from Los Angeles Economic &.description: YouthSource programs provide youth who are not in school and not working with support for work readiness, career guidance, college prep and financial aid, mentoring and counseling, tutoring and computer access, and job skills training.
eligibility: Requires proof of LA county residence

A Place Called Home.name: A Place Called Home
A Place Called Home.description: Multi-service youth and community center serving youth ages eight to mid-twenties and their families. Programs include education services (tutoring and homework assistance), arts programs, community engagement, health and nutrition (cooking classes and free mental health services), career and college guidance, and specialized programs (for students on probation, in the foster care system, and without stable housing).
eligibility: Must have children or be pregnant
A Place Called Home.eligibilityText: Commit to attend at least three days per week, no weapons or violence, and full engagement in the program. For families with children between the ages of 8 and 18.
A Place Called Home.hours:
Summer Schedule
Early Arrival: 8am
Camp Schedule : 9am-3:30pm
Extended Care: 3:30pm-6pm
*Members must arrive no later than 9am.

School Year Schedule
Early Arrival: 1pm
Dismissal: 6:30pm
*Members must arrive no later than 4pm.
A Place Called Home.address: 2830 S Central Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90011

Assistance League of Los Angeles Program.name: Assistance League of Los Angeles Programs - Preschool Learning Center
Assistance League of Los Angeles Program.description: Free preschool education for children ages three to five years old supported by The Preschool Auxiliary which provides supplies and free meals.
Assistance League of Los Angeles Program.eligibilityText: Children 3 to 5 years old from low-income families

Assistance League of Los Angeles Program.name: Assistance League of Los Angeles Programs - Operation School Bell
Assistance League of Los Angeles Program.description: Provides children Pre-K to 5th grade with new school clothing, grooming products, a backpack, shoes, and school supplies. Emergency closets provided for middle and high school students. In-person personalized shopping experiences and “virtual backpack” requests are available.
Assistance League of Los Angeles Program.eligibilityText: Los Angeles County children, ages Preschool through 5th Grade, who are experiencing homelessness, in the foster care system, low-income, or with exceptional needs. Emergency services for middle and high school students.

Assistance League of Los Angeles Program.name: Assistance League of Los Angeles Programs - Foster Children’s Resource Center
Assistance League of Los Angeles Program.description: Serves foster youth from infancy to age 21 by providing children needed clothing, toiletries, backpacks, and school supplies every six months through a personalized shopping experience.
Assistance League of Los Angeles Program.eligibilityText: Foster youth from infancy to age 21

Centro de Ni\u00f1os y Padres.name: Centro de Niños y Padres
Centro de Ni\u00f1os y Padres.description: Special education early learning center providing services to children birth to age three with or at risk for a developmental disability. Also welcomes children without disabilities.
Centro de Ni\u00f1os y Padres.eligibilityText: Birth to age three with or at risk for a developmental disability, but welcomes children without disabilities.
Centro de Ni\u00f1os y Padres.hours:
Office Hours
M-Th: 8AM-4PM, F: 8AM-12PM

Structured Learning Environment Hours
Tu, W, Th: 9AM-12PM
Centro de Ni\u00f1os y Padres.address:
King Hall on the California State University Los Angeles campus: 5151 State University Drive
Los Angeles, CA 90032

Los Angeles County Child Support Service.name: Los Angeles County Child Support Services
Los Angeles County Child Support Service.description: State’s self-service child support website to file and access their case information and payment options.
eligibility: Must have children or be pregnant
Los Angeles County Child Support Service.eligibilityText: Parents or legal caretakers with a child support order or who wants an order. Parentage must be established
Los Angeles County Child Support Service.hours:
8AM-5PM (in person)
Automated response system can take case information 24/7
Customer Contact Center is available M-F: 7AM-5PM, the best time to speak with a Child Support Representative is Tu-F: 7AM-9AM.

2024 Summer Meal Service Sites.name: 2024 Summer Meal Service Sites
2024 Summer Meal Service Sites.description: Map of locations across all California counties where children may receive free meals during school vacations and off-track periods.
2024 Summer Meal Service Sites.eligibilityText: Children 18 years of age and younger during periods when they are out of school for fifteen (15) or more consecutive school days.

AltaMed.name: AltaMed
AltaMed.description: Federally Qualified Health Center with numerous locations in Los Angeles and Orange County offer multiple services including medical, dental, urgent care, pharmacy, and HIV.

Harbor Community Health Centers.name: Harbor Community Health Centers
Harbor Community Health Centers.description: Provide comprehensive healthcare to the San Pedro community (two locations) regardless of their ability to pay including preventive care, immunizations, family planning, STD screenings, and treatment of acute and chronic illnesses. The clinic offers full OB/GYN care, pediatric services, and psychotherapy/mental health options.
Harbor Community Health Centers.address:
593 W 6th St San Pedro, CA 90731 (Location 1)

425 S Pacific Ave, San Pedro, CA 90731 (Location 2)

Mid-Valley Comprehensive Health Center.name: Mid-Valley Comprehensive Health Center
Mid-Valley Comprehensive Health Center.description: Delivers outpatient, primary, urgent, and specialty care services by bilingual and community-oriented health professionals in the San Fernando and Santa Clarita Valleys.
Mid-Valley Comprehensive Health Center.hours:
Patient relations hours: M-F: 8:00 am - 4:15 pm

Clinical Operating Hours: M-Th: 8:00 am - 8:30 pm, F: 8:00 am-4:30 pm
Mid-Valley Comprehensive Health Center.address: 7515 Van Nuys Blvd. Van Nuys, CA 91405

Northeast Valley Health Corporation.name: Northeast Valley Health Corporation
Northeast Valley Health Corporation.description: NEVHC has 17 health centers in the San Fernando and Santa Clarita valleys offering medical, dental, and behavioral health care services.

LA County Public Health Centers.name: LA County Public Health Centers
LA County Public Health Centers.description: Free and low-cost clinical services including immunizations and screening/treatment of sexually transmitted diseases in Los Angeles county. Other services include tuberculosis evaluation clinic and refugee health assessment program by referral only.

Valley Community Healthcare.name: Valley Community Healthcare
Valley Community Healthcare.description: Comprehensive care including general medicine, women’s health, pediatrics, adolescents, dental care, behavioral health, optometry, infectious disease, and nutrition counseling. Telehealth visits are also available.

Koreatown Youth Community Center (KYCC).name: Koreatown Youth Community Center (KYCC)
Koreatown Youth Community Center (KYCC).description: Multiservice organization based in Koreatown that supports children and their families in the areas of education, health, housing, and finances.
Koreatown Youth Community Center (KYCC).address:
3727 West 6th St., Suite 300
Los Angeles, CA 90020

Latino Resource Organization.name: Latino Resource Organization
Latino Resource Organization.description: Provides advocacy, case management, family life education, immigration services, information and referral, and services for older adults.
eligibility: Requires proof of LA county residence
Latino Resource Organization.eligibilityText:
Primarily for people living in Culver City, Santa Monica, Venice and West LA. Services targeted (but not restricted) to Spanish speakers.

Proof of residency in the City of Los Angeles (Utility bill, Rent statement, CA ID or
Drivers' License, Embassy Card, Postmarked mail, etc.)
Proof of low-mid income (Paystub, unemployment benefits, public benefit letter,
bank statement showing direct deposit)
Copy of most recent report card for students in grades K-12
DOCUMENTS CANNOT BE EXPIRED AND/OR OLDER THAN 90 DAYS.
Latino Resource Organization.address:
6736 Laurel Canyon Blvd. #360
North Hollywood. CA
91606

Little Tokyo Service Center (LTSC).name: Little Tokyo Service Center (LTSC)
Little Tokyo Service Center (LTSC).description: Promotes equitable development of ethnic communities and their rich cultural heritage by providing multilingual services, social workers, affordable and transitional housing, supporting small businesses, hosting cultural and educational events, and advocating for patient care.
Little Tokyo Service Center (LTSC).address:
231 E. Third St., Suite G-106
Los Angeles, CA 90013

AbilityFirst.name: AbilityFirst
AbilityFirst.description: Provides a variety of programs designed to help people with disabilities achieve their personal best throughout their lives. Programs include skills building, educational/career support, residential facilities, and community building/recreation.
AbilityFirst.address:
789 North Fair Oaks Ave
Pasadena, CA 91103 (administration)
154 N. Gage Ave. Los Angeles, CA 90063 (East LA Center)
AbilityFirst.moreInfo:

Amputee Coalition.name: Amputee Coalition
Amputee Coalition.description: Serves members of the limb loss and limb different community, their families and caretakers through peer support, education, and advocacy.
Amputee Coalition.address:
601 Pennsylvania Avenue NW, Suite 420, South Building
Washington, DC 20004

Angel City Sports.name: Angel City Sports
Angel City Sports.description: Offers a year-round schedule of introductory adaptive sport clinics, giving athletes opportunities to participate, learn and train in a variety of sports.
Angel City Sports.address: 6060 Center Drive, 10th Floor, #17, Los Angeles, CA, 90045

Disability Rights Legal Center.name: Disability Rights Legal Center
Disability Rights Legal Center.description:
DRLC maintains two specialized programs that focus on providing legal help in areas of pressing concern: 1.) people with disabilities and 2.) those affected by cancer. 
*Clients that meet the above criteria must complete an intake online or via phone. Note: intakes may not always be open - check website.
Disability Rights Legal Center.eligibilityText: Cancer patients or people with disabilities.
Disability Rights Legal Center.address: 1001 Wilshire Blvd., Ste 100 – #3201, Los Angeles, CA 90017 [mailing address only]

Hanger Clinic.name: Hanger Clinic
Hanger Clinic.eligibilityText:
Bring:
- Insurance Card(s) – if you’re covered under multiple plans, please be sure to bring all of the cards 
- Photo ID
- Prescription or Referral

Supplemental Security Income (SSI).name: Supplemental Security Income (SSI)
Supplemental Security Income (SSI).description: SSI provides monthly payments to people with disabilities and older adults who have little or no income or resources.
Supplemental Security Income (SSI).eligibilityText:
Adults and children might be eligible for SSI if they have: 

Little or no income, and 
Little or no resources, and 
A disability, blindness, or are age 65 or older.

Full eligibility here: https://www.ssa.gov/ssi/eligibility

Social Security Disability Insurance (SS.name: Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI)
Social Security Disability Insurance (SS.description: Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI) or “Disability” provides monthly payments to people who have a disability that stops or limits their ability to work.
Social Security Disability Insurance (SS.eligibilityText:
Individuals may be eligible for Disability if they have:

A disability or blindness, and
Enough work history.

Full eligibility here: https://www.ssa.gov/disability/eligibility

Amanecer Community Counseling Service.name: Amanecer Community Counseling Service
Amanecer Community Counseling Service.description: Empowers underserved kids, adults, and domestic abuse victims to overcome barriers and significant life challenges through culturally competent, comprehensive mental health, psychiatric, and case management services.
Amanecer Community Counseling Service.address: 1200 Wilshire Blvd, Suite 300 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Peace Over Violence.name: Peace Over Violence
Peace Over Violence.description: We are a social service agency dedicated to the elimination of sexual and domestic violence and all forms of interpersonal violence. We provide crisis intervention services and violence prevention education. To achieve this mission our agency manages five departments delivering the services of Emergency, Intervention, Prevention, Education and Advocacy.
Peace Over Violence.address: 1541 Wilshire Boulevard, 3 Fl, Los Angeles, CA 90017

YWCA of San Gabriel Valley.name: YWCA of San Gabriel Valley
YWCA of San Gabriel Valley.description: Nonresidential Services include a 24-hour crisis helpline, case management (assessment, care planning, advocacy, financial literacy, and employment readiness). YWCA-SGV also provides culturally sensitive individual and group counseling with trained therapists to help clients heal from their trauma.
YWCA of San Gabriel Valley.address: YWCA San Gabriel Valley 101 South Barranca Ave. Covina, CA 91723

Family PACT.name: Family PACT
Family PACT.description: Free family planning services including birth control methods, family planning counseling and education, STI testing and treatment, HIV testing, cervical cancer screening, limited fertility services.
eligibility: Requires proof of CA residency (not specific to county)
Family PACT.eligibilityText: Resident of California (no age requirement), income at or below 200% of federal poverty income guidelines based on basic family unit, with no other health care that covers family planning needs.

HER Smart Choice - East Los Angeles.name: HER Smart Choice - East Los Angeles
HER Smart Choice - East Los Angeles.description: Services for birth control, abortion, STD testing and treatment, and family planning.
HER Smart Choice - East Los Angeles.eligibilityText: Requires insurance or other forms of payment but has other convenient payment options
HER Smart Choice - East Los Angeles.hours:
For all clinic locations:
M-F: 8AM-8PM, Sat: 8AM-3PM
HER Smart Choice - East Los Angeles.address:
East LA: 
2226 E Cesar E Chavez Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90033

Huntington Park:
7024 Seville Ave Suite A, Huntington Park, CA 90255

Long Beach:
7024 Seville Ave Suite A, Huntington Park, CA 90255

Van Nuys:
7220 Woodman Ave #106, Van Nuys, CA 91405

Los Angeles Abortion Support Collective.name: Los Angeles Abortion Support Collective
Los Angeles Abortion Support Collective.description: Volunteer-led and -run collective providing free emotional, physical, educational, and spiritual support for people seeking abortion.

Los Angeles Regional Food Bank.name: Los Angeles Regional Food Bank
Los Angeles Regional Food Bank.description: Provides food and other essentials, including menstrual hygiene products, to children, seniors, families, and other individuals in need.

M\u00e1s Fresco Program.name: Más Fresco Program
M\u00e1s Fresco Program.description: CalFresh recipients who enroll in the ¡Más Fresco! More Fresh Programs are randomly assigned to earn either $2 in rebate dollars or $4 in rebate dollars for every CalFresh benefit dollar spent on fresh fruits and vegetables. You can earn a maximum of $100 per month of rebate dollars.
M\u00e1s Fresco Program.eligibilityText: Program participants must be a CalFresh recipient, at least 18 years of age or older, and shop at a participating Northgate González Market. They have reached capacity for new participants this year. Please check for announcements about reopening enrollment next year.

California Women, Infants, and Children.name: California Women, Infants, and Children (WIC)
California Women, Infants, and Children.description: WIC services include nutritional education, breastfeeding services, free food, and family resources for qualifying families.
California Women, Infants, and Children.eligibilityText:
Interested families must be pregnant, are breastfeeding a baby under the age of one, had a baby within the last six months, have a child under the age of five, experienced a pregnancy loss/termination and meet income qualifications.

Families receiving Medi-Cal, CalFresh, or CalWORKS may be income-eligible for WIC.

FEEDLA YMCA Metro LA.name: FEEDLA YMCA Metro LA
FEEDLA YMCA Metro LA.description: The Y’s FeedLA initiative provides meals, produce, and essential goods to LA County residents in need.
FEEDLA YMCA Metro LA.eligibilityText: Meals from Summer Meal Sites are for kids ages 1-18 years only.

Aviva.name: Aviva
Aviva.description: Provides mental health services, intensive community based services, foster and adoption programs, and interim supportive housing programs for women and children.

In-Home Supportive Services (IHSS).name: In-Home Supportive Services (IHSS)
In-Home Supportive Services (IHSS).description: Provides in-home assistance to the eligible aged, blind, and disabled individuals as an alternative to out-of-home care. Enables recipients to remain safely in their own homes.
eligibility: Requires proof of CA residency (not specific to county)
In-Home Supportive Services (IHSS).eligibilityText:
You must also be a California resident.
You must have a Medi-Cal eligibility determination.
You must live at home or an abode of your own choosing (acute care hospital, long-term care facilities, and licensed community care facilities are not considered "own home").
You must submit a completed Health Care Certification form

Los Angeles Homeless Services Authority.name: Los Angeles Homeless Services Authority (LAHSA)
Los Angeles Homeless Services Authority.description: LAHSA is the lead agency in the HUD-funded Los Angeles Continuum of Care, and coordinates and manages federal, state, county, and city funds for programs providing shelter, housing, and services to people experiencing homelessness.
Los Angeles Homeless Services Authority.address: 707 Wilshire Blvd Suite 1000, Los Angeles, CA 90017

PATH LA.name: PATH LA
PATH LA.description: Building affordable housing and providing support services for people experiencing homelessness.
PATH LA.address: 340 N. Madison Ave., Los Angeles, CA 90004

Union Rescue Mission.name: Union Rescue Mission
Union Rescue Mission.description: Offers housing, emergency services, recovery programs, learning centers, and clinics to aid men, women, and children experiencing homelessness.
Union Rescue Mission.address: 545 San Pedro St., Los Angeles, CA 90013

California Against Slavery.name: California Against Slavery
California Against Slavery.description: State-level organization that connects survivors of human trafficking with local resources for counseling, education, employment, health services, housing, legal services, etc. (See website for list of organizations.)
California Against Slavery.address: P.O. Box 19323 | San Diego CA 92159 (Mailing Address)

Coalition to Abolish Slavery and Traffic.name: Coalition to Abolish Slavery and Trafficking (CAST)
Coalition to Abolish Slavery and Traffic.description: Provides hotline/emergency response,  immigration assistance, assistance with obtaining identification paperwork, clearing criminal records, accessing state/federal benefits, youth services, and shelter.
Coalition to Abolish Slavery and Traffic.eligibilityText: Shelter serves up to 10 women, 18 and older.

East Los Angeles Women\u2019s Center.name: East Los Angeles Women’s Center
East Los Angeles Women\u2019s Center.description: Provides services for victims of sexual assault, domestic violence, and human trafficking (includes building awareness about human trafficking, offering support to victims and survivors, providing street outreach and outreach to local bars).
East Los Angeles Women\u2019s Center.address:
Main Office: 1431 S. Atlantic Blvd., Los Angeles, CA 90022
Commerce Center: 1508 E. Washington Blvd., Commerce CA 90040
The Wellness Center at Los Angeles General Medical Center: 1200 State St. Suite 1049, Los Angeles, CA 90033

Gems Uncovered.name: Gems Uncovered
Gems Uncovered.description: Provides case management, mentorship, GED programs, mental health support, housing assistance, legal counsel assistance, career development assistance, drug/alcohol rehabilitation referrals, tattoo removal services, etc. for victims of human trafficking and sexual exploitation.
Gems Uncovered.address:
1 World Trade Center
Suite 857
Long Beach, CA 90831

Humansave.name: Humansave
Humansave.description: Provides mental health treatment (in homes, shelters, safe public locations across Los Angeles, Riverside, San Bernardino, Orange counties), awareness and prevention trainings at schools/businesses/etc., life skills services.
Humansave.eligibilityText: *Mental health services provided for individuals in Los Angeles, Riverside, San Bernardino, Orange counties

Journey Out.name: Journey Out
Journey Out.description: Provides services for victims and survivors of sex trafficking or commercial sexual exploitation, including crisis response programming for hospitals and law enforcement, emergency housing/food/clothing, empowerment groups focusing on exiting the commercial sex industry, clinical counseling, legal referrals, vocational training opportunities, intensive case management, survivor mentorship, youth prevention programming, direct street outreach, and community/agency education and training.
Journey Out.address: 7136 Haskell Ave Suite 125, Van Nuys, CA 91406

LA Center for Law and Justice.name: LA Center for Law and Justice
LA Center for Law and Justice.description: Legal services for survivors of human trafficking (e.g., immigration, public benefits, crime victim rights and enforcement, restraining orders, vacatur, family law, other civil needs like education, housing, and employment).
LA Center for Law and Justice.address:
Survivor Justice Center
5301 Whittier Blvd., 4th Floor
Los Angeles, CA 90022
LA Center for Law and Justice.moreInfo: Clients seen by appointment only, no walk-ins.

National Human Trafficking Hotline.name: National Human Trafficking Hotline
National Human Trafficking Hotline.description: Connects victims and survivors of sex and labor trafficking with services and support.

Saving Innocence.name: Saving Innocence
Saving Innocence.description: Provides rehabilitation services to child sex trafficking victims such as life skills, connection to communities, secure placement, legal services, long-term advocacy, and more.
Saving Innocence.address: PO BOX 93037, Los Angeles, CA 90093 (Mailing Address)

Carecen.name: Carecen
Carecen.description: CARECEN has been working to change an unjust immigration system, win legal status for immigrants, and foster community activism on issues such as education reform, workers’ and immigrants’ rights, economic justice and community strengthening.

El Rescate Legal Services.name: El Rescate Legal Services
El Rescate Legal Services.description: Empowers immigrants, primarily Latinos, to improve their political and economic wellbeing in order to promote their full participation as citizens. Provides representation to individuals seeking asylum in the United States based on past persecution or a well-founded fear of future persecution. Provides legal representation to immigrant men, women and children who have been physically abused or subjected to extreme mental cruelty.
El Rescate Legal Services.address: 1605 W. Olympic Blvd. Suite 516 Los Angeles, CA 9001

Esperanza Immigrant Rights Project.name: Esperanza Immigrant Rights Project
Esperanza Immigrant Rights Project.description: Secures legal representation from pro bono or Esperanza-assigned attorneys, reports on systemic and detainee-specific problems in the immigration detention system, and advocates for reform.
Esperanza Immigrant Rights Project.address: 1530 James M Wood Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90015

International Rescue Committee\u2014Los.name: International Rescue Committee—Los Angeles
International Rescue Committee\u2014Los.description: Works with government bodies, civil society actors, and local volunteers to help them translate their past experiences into assets that are valuable to their new communities.

Keck Human Rights Clinic\r.name: Keck Human Rights Clinic
Keck Human Rights Clinic\r.description: Advocates on behalf of asylum seekers by providing pro bono forensic medical and psychological evaluations as part of a patient's legal case for asylum (including defense against deportation).
Keck Human Rights Clinic\r.moreInfo:
Submit a referral: https://sites.usc.edu/keckhumanrights/direct-referral-case-submissions/ 

Social Work Branch Website:
https://dworakpeck.usc.edu/clinical-programs/sdp-keck-human-rights-clinic

USC First Gen Plus Success Center.name: USC First Gen Plus Success Center
USC First Gen Plus Success Center.description: Provides support to USC students who are first generation, former foster youth, undocumented & DACAmented students.
USC First Gen Plus Success Center.eligibilityText: USC students who identify as first-generation, transfer, undocumented, and/or former foster youth.
USC First Gen Plus Success Center.address:
3607 Trousdale Parkway, TCC 224
Los Angeles, CA 90089

Los Angeles Area Pro Bono Directory | Th.name: Los Angeles Area Pro Bono Directory | The State Bar of California
Los Angeles Area Pro Bono Directory | Th.description: Directory of numerous pro bono legal clinics in LA County and surrounding counties, including links, phone numbers, and e-mail contact information.
Los Angeles Area Pro Bono Directory | Th.phone: (213) 765-1000 (For LA Bar office, it is better to contact individuals in the directory)
Los Angeles Area Pro Bono Directory | Th.address:
845 S. Figueroa St.
Los Angeles, CA 90017 [for LA Bar office, better to contact individuals in directory]

Neighborhood Legal Services of Los Angel.name: Neighborhood Legal Services of Los Angeles (NLSLA)
Neighborhood Legal Services of Los Angel.description: Comprehensive pro bono legal services on a range of issues including housing rights, workers’ rights, medical-legal issues, clean slate initiatives and more. Also has self-help legal resources online and  holds legal workshops and clinics each month.
Neighborhood Legal Services of Los Angel.address:
Glendale:
1104 East Chevy Chase Dr
Glendale, CA 91205

Pacoima
13327 Van Nuys Blvd
Pacoima, CA 91331

El Monte
3629 Santa Anita Ave #109
El Monte, CA 91731

The Wellness Center
Historic General Hospital
1200 N State St #1014
Los Angeles, CA 90033

Los Angeles LGBT Center.name: Los Angeles LGBT Center
Los Angeles LGBT Center.description: Offers comprehensive care that's designed specifically for the queer and trans community, including housing, legal aid, healthcare, mental health, and other services for youth aged 18 to seniors aged 98.
Los Angeles LGBT Center.address: 1625 N. Schrader Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90028-6213 (McDonal/Wright Building - health and mental health services, and pharmacy)

Youth Pride Association.name: Youth Pride Association
Youth Pride Association.description: Educate LGBTQ youth through positive examples, support an environment where LGBTQ youth feel represented and safe, advocate for LGBTQ youth to their peers, and ensure the acceptance of LGBTQ youth in their communities.

CalHOPE.name: CalHOPE
CalHOPE.description:
CalHOPE builds community resiliency and helps people recover from disasters through free outreach, crisis counseling, and support services. Services include:
Individual and Group Crisis Counseling and Support
Individual and Public Education
Community Networking and Support
Connection to Resources
Media and Public Service Announcements

Cal-MAP.name: Cal-MAP
Cal-MAP.description: Cal-MAP’s team of mental health specialists supports primary care providers (PCPs) treating youth with mental health needs through education, consultation, and resource navigation. This includes advice on screening, diagnosis, and treatment from a child psychiatrist and guidance on resources and referrals from a social worker.

Crisis Text Line.name: Crisis Text Line
Crisis Text Line.description: Text HOME to 741741 from anywhere in the United States at any time to connect with a live, trained Crisis Counselor via text, who can then help move a person experiencing crisis move from a hot moment to a cool calm. Services are 24/7, free, and confidential.

CDC Disaster Distress Hotline.name: CDC Disaster Distress Hotline
CDC Disaster Distress Hotline.description: National hotline provides crisis counseling and support to people experiencing emotional distress related to natural or human-caused disasters.

Family Urgent Response System.name: Family Urgent Response System
Family Urgent Response System.description: Free 24/7 hotline for current or former foster youth and their caregivers to call and get immediate help

iPrevail Free Mental Health Support for.name: iPrevail Free Mental Health Support for LA County
iPrevail Free Mental Health Support for.description: iPrevail offers online-based interactive lessons, chats with peer support coaches, and topic-based community support groups to anyone in LA county.
iPrevail Free Mental Health Support for.eligibilityText: Only free to those physically in Los Angeles County

Los Angeles Homeless Outreach Portal.name: Los Angeles Homeless Outreach Portal
Los Angeles Homeless Outreach Portal.description: Operated by the Los Angeles Homeless Service Authority and designed to assist people experiencing homelessness and in crisis by dispatching homeless outreach teams throughout Los Angeles County.

Mental Health Services and Referrals LA.name: Mental Health Services and Referrals LA County
Mental Health Services and Referrals LA.description: 24/7 mental health resources hotline. Offers an access line for service referrals, crisis assessments, field deployments; another "Emotional Support Warm Line" available 10:30am to 9pm; and a "Veteran Line" available 9am to 8pm.
Mental Health Services and Referrals LA.hours:
24/7 (hotline)

Emotional Support Warm Line: 10:30AM-9PM

Veteran Line: 9AM-8PM

National Suicide Prevention Hotline.name: National Suicide Prevention Hotline
National Suicide Prevention Hotline.description: Provides confidential emotional support to people in suicidal crisis or emotional distress 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, across the United States

National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAM.name: National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI)
National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAM.description: NAMI provides advocacy, education, support and public awareness so that all individuals and families affected by mental illness can build better lives.

TheHopeLine.name: TheHopeLine
TheHopeLine.description: A service available to youth and teens to chat about topics on relationships, self-care, trauma, sex, addiction, and mental health  with a hope coach and have access to suicide resources 24/7

The Trevor Project Lifeline.name: The Trevor Project Lifeline
The Trevor Project Lifeline.description: Provides anonymous support to LGBTQ+ youths and allies in crisis or in need of a safe and judgment-free place to talk available 24/7 via text,chat, or call.

Veterans Crisis Line.name: Veterans Crisis Line
Veterans Crisis Line.description: Veterans and their loved ones can call 988 and Press 1, chat online, or send a text message to 838255 to receive confidential support 24 hours a day.

CORE (Connecting to Opportunities for Re.name: CORE (Connecting to Opportunities for Recovery and Engagement) Centers
CORE (Connecting to Opportunities for Re.description: Community spaces to get info and resources for substance use prevention and free or low-cost treatment services (for Medi-Cal/My Health LA clients).
CORE (Connecting to Opportunities for Re.phone:
(844) 804-7500 (substance abuse service helpline),

(323) 568-8732 (MLK Healing Center),

(323) 236-4155 (Luis Renteria)
CORE (Connecting to Opportunities for Re.address:
1000 South Fremont Ave, Building A-9 East, 3rd Floor
Alhambra, CA 91803 (Main office, not a CORE center)

11833 S. Wilmington Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 90059
(MLK Healing Center)

Harm Reduction Syringe Services Programs.name: Harm Reduction Syringe Services Programs
Harm Reduction Syringe Services Programs.description: Provides supplies including sterile syringes, naloxone, sharps containers, alcohol pads, cottons, fentanyl test strips, & condoms.
Harm Reduction Syringe Services Programs.phone:
(626) 457-4078​ (USC Street Medicine​),

(213) 372-5233 (Los Angeles Centers for Alcohol and Drug Abuse (LA CADA)​)
Harm Reduction Syringe Services Programs.address:
1000 S. Fremont Avenue, Unit 22, Bldg. A-6, 4th Floor, Alhambra 91803 (USC Street Medicine​)

​307 S. Central Avenue, Los Angeles 90013 (Los Angeles Centers for Alcohol and Drug Abuse (LA CADA)​)
Harm Reduction Syringe Services Programs.moreInfo: Full list of locations on website

LA County Substance Abuse Service Helpli.name: LA County Substance Abuse Service Helpline (SASH)
LA County Substance Abuse Service Helpli.description: Nurse/substance use counselor-staffed line to ask questions and get referred for services.
LA County Substance Abuse Service Helpli.phone:
(844) 804-7500 (TTY: 711),

(213) 626-6411 (Los Angeles Centers for Alcohol and Drug Abuse)
LA County Substance Abuse Service Helpli.address:
426 San Pedro Street,
Los Angeles, CA 90013 (Los Angeles Centers for Alcohol and Drug Abuse)
LA County Substance Abuse Service Helpli.moreInfo: Full list of locations on website

Over-the-Counter Naloxone Access.name: Over-the-Counter Naloxone Access
Over-the-Counter Naloxone Access.description: Naloxone can be purchased (~$50) at participating pharmacies and retailers.
Over-the-Counter Naloxone Access.moreInfo:
More information: http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/sapc/public/harm-reduction/
Full list of locations on website

ACCESS Paratransit.name: ACCESS Paratransit
ACCESS Paratransit.description: Curb-to-curb shared-rid transportation program that is available for elderly individuals and individuals with disabilities within Los Angeles County. Rides must be scheduled ahead of time (emergency or same-day transportation services are not available).
ACCESS Paratransit.eligibilityText:
Eligibility is based on your functional abilities to use fixed route bus or train services. (Application, in-person evaluation with Photo ID)

Full eligbility:
https://accessla.org/sites/default/files/Eligibility/Applying%20for%20Access%20Fillable%20090723%20ENG.pdf (English)
https://accessla.org/sites/default/files/Eligibility/Applying%20for%20Access%20Fillable%20090723%20SPAN.pdf (Spanish)
ACCESS Paratransit.address: 3449 Santa Anita Ave., El Monte, 91731 (Access Services Headquarters)
ACCESS Paratransit.moreInfo:
SoCal ADA Paratransit: https://accessla.org/other_mobility_resources/other_mobility_resourcessocala.html 

Regional transit routes: https://accessla.org/other_mobility_resources/links_to_local_transit_agencie.html

AMTRAK.name: AMTRAK
AMTRAK.description: 10% rail fare discount is available for adult passengers with a disability and companions/support staff of a passenger with a disability. Written proof must be provided when boarding.
AMTRAK.moreInfo: Form: https://www.amtrak.com/contact-us/email.html, select "Accessibility Requests/Feedback" as subject option

Cityride Dial-A-Ride.name: Cityride Dial-A-Ride
Cityride Dial-A-Ride.description: Low-cost ($2-4 per ride) shared transportation for pre-scheduled trips of 10 miles or less one-way.
eligibility: Requires proof of LA county residence
Cityride Dial-A-Ride.eligibilityText: Individuals age 65 or older and qualified persons with disabilities in the City of Los Angeles and select areas of Los Angeles County (Marina Del Rey, Kagel Canyon, Topanga, and areas near Calabasas, Chatsworth, Carson, and Long Beach) are eligible to participate in the Cityride program.
Cityride Dial-A-Ride.address: Cityride P.O. Box 866003 Los Angeles, CA 90086 [mailing address only]

Dial-A-Ride Services (LA Public Works).name: Dial-A-Ride Services (LA Public Works)
Dial-A-Ride Services (LA Public Works).description: Curb-to-curb shared ride service that is available for elderly individuals and individuals with disabilities in the unincorporated areas of Los Angeles County. Rides must be scheduled ahead of time, and Dial-A-Ride operates 24/7 in some areas of LA county.
Dial-A-Ride Services (LA Public Works).moreInfo:
Service areas shown here: https://pw.lacounty.gov/transit/DAR.aspx 

Part of ACCESS Paratransit

LA Care.name: LA Care
LA Care.description: Free transportation (emergency and non-emergency) for caregivers on M-F (9am-5pm), as well as LA Care Medi-Cal members.
LA Care.phone:
(855) 427-1223 (L.A. Care general line),

(888) 839-9909 (Medi-Cal),

(855) 270-2327 (L.A. Care Covered or L.A. Care Covered Direct),

(833) 522-3767 (L.A. Care Medicare Plus)
LA Care.address:
L.A. Care Health Plan
1200 W. 7th Street
Los Angeles, CA 90017

Los Angeles Metro.name: Los Angeles Metro
Los Angeles Metro.description: Discounted fares are available for seniors (62 years or older), individuals with disabilities, individuals with Medicare, low-income individuals, K-12 students, and college/vocational students. Applications for discounted fares are available at Metro Customer Centers or via phone.
Los Angeles Metro.eligibilityText: Seniors (62 years or older), individuals with disabilities, individuals with Medicare, students (college or K-12).
Los Angeles Metro.address:
TAP Reduced Fare Office
One Gateway Plaza
Mail Stop 99-PL-4
Los Angeles, CA 90012-2952 [mailing address, multiple physical addresses]

Wellness Center at Historic General Hosp.name: Wellness Center at Historic General Hospital
Wellness Center at Historic General Hosp.description: The Wellness Center offers free programs and services focusing on improving the health and well-being of residents in Boyle Heights and neighboring Eastside communities.
Wellness Center at Historic General Hosp.address: Historic General Hospital, 1st Floor, 1200 N. State Street, Los Angeles , CA 90033

Mexican American Opportunity Foundation.name: Mexican American Opportunity Foundation
Mexican American Opportunity Foundation.description: Provides social services for Mexican Americans through early child education services, senior services, community development services, and community partnership services.
Mexican American Opportunity Foundation.address:
5100 S. Eastern Ave.,
2nd Floor, Suite 200
Commerce, CA 90040 (MAOF Los Angeles)

401 N. Garfield Ave.,
Montebello, CA 90640 (
MAOF Headquarters)

2130 Chester Ave., Suite 200
Bakersfield, CA 93301

(MAOF Skill Center)

11 Quail Run Circle, Suite 101
Salinas, CA 93907

USC Street Medicine.name: USC Street Medicine
USC Street Medicine.description: Provides health services to unhoused indivduals in their own environments, focusing on patient-centered care, harm reduction, and providing follow-up services.
USC Street Medicine.phone: (323) 442-1900 (KSOM number, not specific to USC Street Medicine)
USC Street Medicine.address:
1975 Zonal Ave.
Los Angeles, CA 90033 (Keck School of Medicine Address; Street Medicine team operates in many different neighborhoods)

Violence Intervention Program (VIP).name: Violence Intervention Program (VIP)
Violence Intervention Program (VIP).description: Offers support to victims of domestic and sexual violence. VIP includes a Medical Village, Sexual Assault Center, Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder Program, LGBTQ+ clinic, and mental health services for youth, adults, and seniors.
Violence Intervention Program (VIP).phone:
(323) 221-4134,

(323) 221-4134 (Mental Health Center),

(323) 409-5086 (Child Abuse Assessment Clinic),

(323) 409-3800 (Sexual Assault Center),

(323) 409-1470 (Elder Abuse Forensic Center)

Job Corps.name: Job Corps
Job Corps.description: Helps students learn obtain the skills, training, and resources necessary to enter the workforce, offering free housing, meals, training gear, and more.
eligibility: Requires proof of U.S. residence (not specific to CA)
Job Corps.eligibilityText:
Are 16 through 24 years old, low-income individuals who
meet citizenship, residency, DACA or other approved status requirements and background requirements.

Youth Build.name: Youth Build
Youth Build.description: Provides vocational skills, job training, and education to youth without a secondary degree to facillitate employment while simultaneously helping youth towards degree obtainment.
Youth Build.eligibilityText: Between the ages of 16 and 24 who are out of school and out of work
Youth Build.address:
YouthBuild Global
1785 Columbus Avenue
Suite 500
Roxbury, MA 02119 (mailing address)

Multiple locations:
https://youthbuild.org/our-programs/

Homeboy Industries.name: Homeboy Industries
Homeboy Industries.description: Assists formerly gang-involved or previously incarcerated individuals by offering tattoo removal, educational assistance, Batterer's intervention, anger management classes, parenting classes, legal assistance, substance abuse assistance, workforce development, and more.
Homeboy Industries.address: 130 W. Bruno St., Los Angeles, CA 30019

House of Ruth.name: House of Ruth
House of Ruth.description: Provides support services and offers permanent housing solutions for victims of domestic violence, especially those who are now experiencing houselessness. There are also "After Care" options for former clients.
House of Ruth.address:
Written communications only:
Los Angeles House of Ruth
PO Box 33288
Los Angeles, CA 90033-1727

Locations of houses confidential, but near Downtown LA

Jewish Family Service LA.name: Jewish Family Service LA
Jewish Family Service LA.description: Comitted to serving all of Los Angeles, not only the Jewish community, through services such as food resources, domestic violence support, resources for seniors, mental health help, educational services, and supportive services for individuals with special needs. See sites for specific programs offered.
Jewish Family Service LA.address: 330 N. Fairfax Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 90036 (Main, but there are mutliple locations)

Meals on Wheels America.name: Meals on Wheels America
Meals on Wheels America.description: Delivers meals directly to homes of seniors in America, taking into account diverse nutrition and mobility needs. Visits also include safety checks to ensure seniors are not undergoing medical emergencies. Meals may be provided lower costs or at full price, depending on individual circumatances.
Meals on Wheels America.eligibilityText: "Meals on Wheels focuses on caring for individuals whose diminished mobility makes it hard to shop for food, prepare meals or socialize with others. Generally programs serve adults 60 and over, although age requirements can vary by program and areas served. People who are mobile enough to join others for meals in a group setting where seniors congregate, like senior centers and cafes, are encouraged to do so; while others less mobile may qualify for home delivery."
Meals on Wheels America.address:
1550 Crystal Drive, Suite 1004
Arlington, Virginia 22202 (Mailing address)

Via Care LA.name: Via Care LA
Via Care LA.description: Provides primary medical, dental, behavioral health and supportive services to LA County residents regardless of income or insurance status. Also offers addiction treatment, enhanced case management, legal aid to prevent homelessness among those with mental disabilities, and reentry services.
Via Care LA.hours:
Main phone line/administrative headquarters (see website for individual site hours):
M-F: 8AM-5PM
Via Care LA.address:
Via Care
3601 E. 1st Street
Los Angeles, CA 90063 (Mailing address)
Via Care LA.moreInfo:
Link to request an appointment: https://www.viacarela.org/patients-visitors/request-an-appointment/

Locations with hours:
https://www.viacarela.org/location-hours

Neighborhood Legal Services.name: Neighborhood Legal Services
Neighborhood Legal Services.description: Provides free legal assistance to low-income reisdents of Los Angeles, with a focus on areas of the law that disproportionately impact low-income people. Examples of services include legal help for healthcare, housing/eviction, immigration, and workers' rights.
Neighborhood Legal Services.hours:
Apply online: 24/7
Apply In-Person: M-Th: 1PM-4PM
Apply by Phone: M-F: 9AM-12PM, 1PM-4PM

The Wellness Center:
Assistance by phone: M-F: 9AM-12PM; 1PM-5PM
In-Person Services: Tu, Th: 9AM-12PM, 1PM-5PM
Neighborhood Legal Services.address:
Glendale:
1104 East Chevy Chase Dr
Glendale, CA 91205

Pacoima:
13327 Van Nuys Blvd
Pacoima, CA 91331

El Monte:
3629 Santa Anita Ave #109
El Monte, CA 91731

The Wellness Center:
Historic General Hospital
1200 N State St #1014
Los Angeles, CA 90033

Bet Tzedek.name: Bet Tzedek
Bet Tzedek.description: Provides person-centered legal services that integrate with social support services, educate community members with the powerful knowledge of their legal rights, and uses our collective voice to reform systems. Programs are available that focus on seniors and dependent adults, workers, taxpayers, small business owners, tenants, homeowners, unhoused individuals, children and families, and transgender individuals.
eligibility: Requires proof of LA county residence
Bet Tzedek.address:
3250 Wilshire Blvd.
13th Floor
Los Angeles, CA 90010

Project Angel Food.name: Project Angel Food
Project Angel Food.description: Nourishes the health and spirit of vulnerable people facing critical and life-threatening illness by preparing and delivering medically tailored meals with love, care and dignity.
Project Angel Food.eligibilityText:
Eligible clients typically have one or more:
• HIV or AIDS, especially with an active viral presence or low CD4 count
• Cancer, undergoing treatment
• Uncontrolled diabetes with A1c indicator over 8
• COPD or other respiratory disease requiring 24-hour or frequent oxygen.
• End stage renal disease with one or more of the following:
o Serious comorbidity
o Additional mobility-limiting circumstances
o Dialysis that has begun in the previous 6 months
o Over age 75
• Serious liver disease
• Advanced congestive heart failure, recent stroke or heart attack
• Serious neurological or muscular disease such as Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, or ALS

Housing for Health.name: Housing for Health
Housing for Health.description: Provides housing and critical services to homeless and formerly homeless people in LA County, with programs work to meet the needs of people with complex health and behavioral health conditions. Delivers an integrated system of care that connects housing, health services, intensive case management, and income supports.

Illumination Foundation.name: Illumination Foundation
Illumination Foundation.description: Serves over 3,000 individuals and families daily with integrated housing and healthcare services, providing a comprehensive safety net of client-centered services for the most vulnerable individuals, families, and children.
Illumination Foundation.address:
Anaheim Service Center (Families needing housing)
883 S. Anaheim Blvd., Anaheim, CA 92805

Stanton Housing Office (Individuals needing housing)
7855 Katella Ave., Stanton, CA 90680

Santa Ana Corporate Office (Corporate Contact)
2871 Pullman St., Santa Ana, CA 92705

David L. Murphy Sobering Center.name: David L. Murphy Sobering Center
David L. Murphy Sobering Center.description: Reduces incarcerations, minimizes hospitalizations and assists active, chronic and serial inebriates living on and around Skid Row by providing a path to recovery in a safe and welcoming environment.
David L. Murphy Sobering Center.eligibilityText:
Specific and designated referral sources (no walk-ins):
- Law enforcement
- Some emergency personnel
- Designated outreach teams working in the Skid Row area

Target Population:
- Catchment area is downtown Los Angeles. Skid Row and area adjacent
- Predominately homeless, intoxicated individuals who might otherwise be picked up by law enforcement for petty crimes, and/or those who present or are transported by emergency personnel to a hospital ED for issues related to inebriation

Rancho Los Amigos.name: Rancho Los Amigos
Rancho Los Amigos.description: Restores health, rebuilds life, and revitalizes hope for persons with a life-changing illness, injury or disability.
Rancho Los Amigos.eligibilityText: Bring a photo ID or be prepared to verify your information.

MAMA\u2019s Neighborhood Program.name: MAMA’s Neighborhood Program
MAMA\u2019s Neighborhood Program.description: Provides prenatal and postpartum care, working closely with patients throughout their pregnancy, and up to one year postpartum, to make sure you have everything you need to promote health and wellbeing for the whole family. This includes support around issues such as stress, mental health, complicated relationships, substance use, housing, parenting education, and access to healthy foods.
MAMA\u2019s Neighborhood Program.phone:
(844) 376-2627 (Prenatal Care and MAMA's),

(877) 227-3121 (Abortion Care),

(844) 804-0055 (General Health Services, Cancer Screenings and Mammograms)

Al Otro Lado.name: Al Otro Lado
Al Otro Lado.description: Provides holistic legal and humanitarian support to refugees, deportees, and other migrants in the US and Tijuana through a multidisciplinary, client-centered, harm reduction-based practice.
Al Otro Lado.address:
511 E. San Ysidro Blvd., # 333 
San Ysidro, CA 92173 (Mailing address)

Transition Age Youth (TAY).name: Transition Age Youth (TAY)
Transition Age Youth (TAY).description: Prevents homelessness and secures and maintains housing for young adults aged 18 to 24 years, inclusive, with priority given to those currently or formerly in the foster care or probation systems.
Transition Age Youth (TAY).eligibilityText: Eligible applicants are county child welfare services agencies that demonstrate a need to provide housing for young adults aged 18 to 24 years, inclusive, with priority given to those currently or formerly in the foster care or probation systems.
Transition Age Youth (TAY).address:
651 Bannon Street
Sacramento, CA 95811 (California Department of Housing & Community Development, Mailing address/office)

Adolescent Care and Transition (ACT) Cli.name: Adolescent Care and Transition (ACT) Clinic
Adolescent Care and Transition (ACT) Cli.description: Comprehensive medical homes for high risk teens and children with chronic medical illnesses transitioning into adult care. Providers are board certified in both pediatrics and internal medicine, and work closely with a team of social workers, case managers, and mental health specialists. Services provided include primary medical care (including care for infants/children, pregnant/parenting teens, LGBTQ youth and young adults, and young adults with chronic medical illness) and contraception counseling and placement.
Adolescent Care and Transition (ACT) Cli.address: 2010 Zonal Avenue, 3rd floor, 3P-40A, Los Angeles, CA 90033

National Maternal Mental Health Hotline.name: National Maternal Mental Health Hotline
National Maternal Mental Health Hotline.description: Free and confidential hotline for pregnant or new mothers. Professional counseolrs will listen to what clients are going through, connect them with local support groups and organizations, and refer them to other health care professionals if they need more care.

New Familia.name: New Familia
New Familia.description: Provides bilingual perinatal and postpartum care, including childbirth education, lactation support, nutrition counseling, diabetes education, and mental health services.
New Familia.address:
2716 N Broadway Suite 203, 
Los Angeles, CA 90031

LAGMC CARES Mobile Food Pantry.name: LAGMC CARES Mobile Food Pantry
LAGMC CARES Mobile Food Pantry.description: Provides free healthy food distributions in collaboration with LA Regional Food Bank. Events are open to all families and take place regularly on the LAGMC campus.
LAGMC CARES Mobile Food Pantry.address: 1200 N State Street, Los Angeles, CA 90033 (Walkway between Building B and Old General Hospital)

Postpartum Support International (PSI).name: Postpartum Support International (PSI)
Postpartum Support International (PSI).description: Provides perinatal mental health support through a helpline, online support groups, peer mentorship, and a directory of trained providers.

Maternal Mental Health Now.name: Maternal Mental Health Now
Maternal Mental Health Now.description: Provides education, digital self-care tools, and a referral directory to support perinatal individuals and families affected by depression and anxiety.

Covered California.name: Covered California
Covered California.description: California’s health insurance marketplace offering subsidized and full-cost plans from private insurers. Connects residents with Medi-Cal or commercial health coverage based on income and eligibility.
eligibility: Requires proof of CA residency (not specific to county)
Covered California.eligibilityText: Must be a CA resident with legal immigration status. Eligibility and subsidies based on income. Medi-Cal screening included.
Covered California.moreInfo: Enrollment available year-round for Medi-Cal; open enrollment and special enrollment periods for others.

Al-Anon.name: Al-Anon
Al-Anon.description: Peer-led support groups for people affected by someone else's alcoholism. Offers free, anonymous meetings (in-person and virtual) and recovery resources.

Alcoholics Anonymous.name: Alcoholics Anonymous
Alcoholics Anonymous.description: Peer-led recovery support group for individuals with alcohol use disorder. Offers free, anonymous in-person and virtual meetings based on a 12-step model.

Alzheimer's Association.name: Alzheimer's Association
Alzheimer's Association.description: Provides support groups, 24/7 helpline, care planning, legal and financial education, and referrals for individuals with dementia and their caregivers.

Braille Institute.name: Braille Institute
Braille Institute.description: Offers free services to blind and visually impaired individuals, including library access, tech training, independent living skills, support groups, and educational classes.
Braille Institute.eligibilityText: Most services are open to anyone with vision loss; some programs (e.g. library access) may require documentation.
Braille Institute.address: 741 North Vermont Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 90029
Braille Institute.moreInfo: Offers access to the National Library Service for the print-disabled; adjacent to LA City College and accessible via public transit.

Glendale Adult Recreation Center.name: Glendale Adult Recreation Center
Glendale Adult Recreation Center.description: Offers a wide range of social, fitness, educational, and recreational programs for adults, with a focus on seniors. Services include exercise classes, drop-in games, clubs, and lifelong learning opportunities.
Glendale Adult Recreation Center.eligibilityText: Open to adults; senior programs require age verification. Activity Card and additional fees may apply for certain activities.

Forrest Lawn Grief Support.name: Forrest Lawn Grief Support
Forrest Lawn Grief Support.description: Offers free seminars, support articles, and seasonal workshops to help individuals and families process grief. Topics include understanding grief and navigating holidays after loss.

Our House Grief Support.name: Our House Grief Support
Our House Grief Support.description: Provides grief support groups for children, teens, and adults; grief education for professionals; and on-site grief response services across Los Angeles County.
Our House Grief Support.address:
West LA: 3415 S Sepulveda Blvd, Suite 120, Los Angeles, CA 90034

Woodland Hills: 21860 Burbank Blvd, Suite 195, Woodland Hills, CA 91367

Los Angeles Mission.name: Los Angeles Mission
Los Angeles Mission.description: Provides emergency shelter, meals, clothing, showers, job training, academic courses, and referral services for individuals experiencing homelessness.
Los Angeles Mission.moreInfo: Programs include long-term recovery, vocational training, and spiritual support. Offers three meals daily and overnight accommodations.

Narcotics Anonymous.name: Narcotics Anonymous
Narcotics Anonymous.description: Peer-led support groups for individuals recovering from drug addiction. Offers anonymous, no-cost meetings both in-person and virtually based on a 12-step model.

Prenatal Classes at USC Arcadia Hospital.name: Prenatal Classes at USC Arcadia Hospital
Prenatal Classes at USC Arcadia Hospital.hours:
Prepared Childbirth Class:
Tu: 6PM-9PM

Breastfeeding Support Group:
W: 10:30AM-11:30AM

Breastfeeding Class:
F: 6PM-9PM

Red Cross of Los Angeles.name: Red Cross of Los Angeles
Red Cross of Los Angeles.description: Provides disaster response, emergency shelter, meals, casework support, preparedness training, and blood donation services across Los Angeles County.

Silver Sneakers.name: Silver Sneakers
Silver Sneakers.description: Free fitness and wellness program for adults 65+ through Medicare Advantage plans. Offers gym memberships, group classes, and virtual fitness resources.

Special Olympics Los Angeles.name: Special Olympics Los Angeles
Special Olympics Los Angeles.description: The mission of Special Olympics Southern California is to provide year-round sports training and athletic competition in a variety of Olympic-type sports for children and adults with intellectual disabilities, giving them continuing opportunities to develop physical fitness, demonstrate courage, experience joy and participate in a sharing of gifts, skills and friendship with their families, other Special Olympics athletes and the community.
Special Olympics Los Angeles.eligibilityText: Proof of a separate medical screening is no longer a requirement for athlete registration.
Special Olympics Los Angeles.address:
1600 Forbes Way
Suite 200
Long Beach, CA
90810

St James In-The-City Episcopal Church.name: St James In-The-City Episcopal Church
St James In-The-City Episcopal Church.description: St. James' Church thrives on worship, music, and service. Services include soup kitchens, food pantries, clothing donations, childcare, and community gatherings.

Stepping Stones At Verdugo Hospital.name: Stepping Stones At Verdugo Hospital
Stepping Stones At Verdugo Hospital.description:
Our inpatient program offers free 24/7 crisis assessments for individuals 50 years of age or older who may need inpatient admission. This program may benefit individuals exhibiting the following behaviors: Anxiousness, Actions that endanger self and others, Experiencing hallucinations, Making statements or gestures about suicide, Feelings of paranoia, Experiencing decline in the ability to function, Withdrawing from social activities.

Our outpatient program provides assessment, therapies and a wide variety of emotional and mental health care options to meet the individual needs of adults ages 50 and over who are suffering from: A decline in daily functioning, Insomnia, other sleep issues and restlessness, Sadness, isolation, low motivation or changes in energy levels, Panic and anxiety, Persistent thoughts, pain or discomfort, Unresolved grief or other feelings of loss

Society of Asylum Medicine.name: Society of Asylum Medicine
Society of Asylum Medicine.description: We are physicians and other clinicians who provide trauma-informed medical and mental health forensic evaluations of asylum seekers. We work with legal and human rights professionals, advocates, and a variety of community-facing organizations to establish and follow best practices in preparing medical-legal documentation of torture and ill-treatment in individuals who claim persecution and human rights abuses. The Society of Asylum Medicine welcomes professionals* who are dedicated to supporting culturally-sensitive, objective evaluations of those alleging persecution and seeking safety in another country.

Los Angeles Raids and Response Network (.name: Los Angeles Raids and Response Network (California Collaborative for Immigrant Justice)
Los Angeles Raids and Response Network (.description: From its origins until 2021, CCIJ was a fiscally-sponsored project. In July 2020, CCIJ embarked on the journey of becoming an independent 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, a goal we reached on January 1, 2022. We utilize coordination, advocacy, and legal services to fight for the liberation of immigrants in detention in California.
Los Angeles Raids and Response Network (.moreInfo: Under California Collaborative for Immigrant Justice

Seating Center at Rancho Los Amigos.name: Seating Center at Rancho Los Amigos
Seating Center at Rancho Los Amigos.description: The largest program of its kind in Southern California, the Seating Center at Rancho Los Amigos National Rehabilitation Center helps individuals to identify customized wheelchairs (and related equipment) to realize effective independent mobility for an active life. Physical Therapists, who are specially trained in wheelchair and equipment selection evaluate the unique needs of each individual to an appropriate mobility solution.  Exceptional care is taken to collaborate with clients and family members to choose a safe, comfortable, and supportive wheelchair system that provides mobility at home and in the community.
Seating Center at Rancho Los Amigos.eligibilityText: If new equipment is recommended, Seating Center staff will coordinate the ordering process with the client’s physician, equipment supplier, and medical insurance provider and will deliver follow-up care to ensure that the equipment fits and is working effectively.
Seating Center at Rancho Los Amigos.moreInfo: Please complete the Outpatient Therapy Referral Form – Community and send or fax these forms to the Seating Center prior to making an appointment.

CicLAvia.name: CicLAvia
CicLAvia.description: CicLAvia is a 501(c)(3) non-profit that catalyzes vibrant public spaces, active transportation, and good health through car-free streets. CicLAvia engages with people to transform our relationship with our communities and with each other. Inspired by Bogotá’s weekly ciclovía, CicLAvia temporarily closes streets to car traffic and opens them to Angelenos to use as a public park. Free for all, CicLAvia connects communities to each other across an expansive city, creating a safe place to bike, walk, skate, roll, and dance through Los Angeles County.
CicLAvia.address:
525 S. Hewitt St.
Los Angeles, CA 90013

Safe Youth Zone.name: Safe Youth Zone
Safe Youth Zone.description: The Safe Youth Zone initiative is a way to ensure temporary haven for any youth who faces a potentially threatening situation and needs a place to go, particularly those in danger from human trafficking and abuse. Oftentimes these youth have no place to go for help and end up going back to unsafe spaces, exploiters, traffickers, or other situations where they may be subjected to more abuse, neglect, and/or exploitation.
Safe Youth Zone.moreInfo: All LA County sherriff's stations, hospitals, clinics, fire departments, schools are designated as Safe Youth Zones.
